info.name: OneProvider Public Collection
info.description:
#### Welcome to OneProvider's public API!

Make sure your API keys are entered in the 'Variables' section to start making API calls!

###### For more information, see our [official documentation](https://panel.op-net.com/api).

item.name: /SERVER

request.description: Returns a list of all servers and VMs.
Return a server's information.

response.name: /server/info/{{server_id}}
response.body:
{  
    "result": "success",  
    "response": {  
        "server_id": "0000",  
        "ip_addr": "123.123.123.123",  
        "hostname": "hostname.example.com",  
        "status": "Active",  
        "username": "root/oneprovider",  
        "root_password": "1q2w3e4r5t",  
        "bandwidth": "2000 Gb / 10 Mbps",  
        "hdd": "2x 500GB",  
        "ram": "4GB",  
        "cpu": "Intel Xeon E3-1230 3.20 GHz",  
        "max_ip": "2",  
        "os": "Centos 6.4 64BITS",  
        "next_due_date": "0000/00/00",  
        "billing_cycle": "Monthly",  
        "recurring_amount": 0.00,  
        "location": "Paris, FR",  
        "cancel_reason": "null",  
        "cancel_type": "null",  
        "manager_type": "OneProvider-1",  
        "ips": "124.124.124.124"  
    }  
}

request.description: Return a list of the methods available to manage a specific server.

response.name: /server/manage/{{server_id}}

formdata.description: The method name specified in the list obtained with the /server/manage/ call.

request.description: Send a command to a server using the method list obtained with the /server/manage/ call.

response.name: /server/action

formdata.description: The method name specified in the list obtained with the /server/manage/ call.
The cancellation type [Immediate | End of Billing Period]

request.description: Request a cancellation on a server or a VM.

response.name: /server/cancel

formdata.description: The cancellation type [Immediate | End of Billing Period]

request.description: Remove an existing cancellation request on a server or a VM.

response.name: /server/remove/cancellation

formdata.description: The new hostname of the server

request.description: Change a server's hostname.

formdata.description: The new hostname of the server

item.description:
The /server section of the API allows its user to programmatically do what the client panel server manager does.

For exemple it can be used to automatically iterate througt all of a user server and execute the reboot action on each one that allow it.

**Warning:**

- Not all server have the same action available to them, use the /server/manage/{{server_id}} method to see all the available action for the server.
    
- The parameters and return format of the /server/action method is different depending on the action requested.

item.name: /VM

request.description: Returns a list of all you OneCloud projects.
Get a list of your virtual servers.
Get a list of your virtual servers.

response.name: /vm/list (Deprecated)
response.body:

            }
        ]
    }
}

request.description: Get a virtual server's information: status, available templates and iso images.

response.name: /vm/info/{{vm_id}}

request.description: Returns a list of the available OS.
Get a list of the available locations.
Returns a list of SSH keys.
Returns a list of your instances' images.

request.description: Get a list of available plan sizes.

response.name: /vm/sizes

formdata.description: The name of the addon to add

request.description: Add an addon to a VM.

response.name: /vm/addon/add

formdata.description: The name of the addon to add
The ID of the addon to remove (from the /vm/info call)

request.description: Remove an addon from a VM.

response.name: /vm/addon/remove

formdata.description: The ID of the addon to remove (from the /vm/info call)

request.description: Turn the automatic bandwidth suspension on when the limit is reached.
Boot a virtual server.

formdata.description: The virtual server's new boot sequence [cda (1)Hard Disk (2)CDROM | dca ((1)CDROM (2)Hard Disk)]

request.description: Change the boot order on a virtual server.

formdata.description: The virtual server's new boot sequence [cda (1)Hard Disk (2)CDROM | dca ((1)CDROM (2)Hard Disk)]
The instance's size ID. [A list of available sizes can be returned with the /vm/sizes/ call]
The ID of the OS' template or the UUID of the image to install [A list of available templates can be returned with the /vm/templates call and images with /vm/images/list]
The New hostname of the VM
(optional) Array of addon IDs [A list of available addons can be returned with the /vm/sizes call]

request.description: Create a virtual server.

formdata.description: The instance's size ID. [A list of available sizes can be returned with the /vm/sizes/ call]
The ID of the OS' template or the UUID of the image to install [A list of available templates can be returned with the /vm/templates call and images with /vm/images/list]
The New hostname of the VM
(optional) Array of addon IDs [A list of available addons can be returned with the /vm/sizes call]
The instance's size ID. [A list of available sizes can be returned with the /vm/sizes/ call]

request.description: Resize a virtual server.

formdata.description: The instance's size ID. [A list of available sizes can be returned with the /vm/sizes/ call]
Parameter to confirm you want to pay the bandwidth overage

formdata.description: Parameter to confirm you want to pay the bandwidth overage

request.description: Change virtual server's hostname.
Create a new image from the given instance.

Change root password.
Force the instance to power off; unlike a graceful shutdown, this action will not wait for the processes.

formdata.description: If the project should become the new default

request.description: Create an OC project in which you can split your instances for different purposes.

formdata.description: If the project should become the new default

formdata.description: The ID of the OS' template or the UUID of the image to install [A list of available templates can be returned with the /vm/templates call and images with /vm/images/list]

The password to access your instance in rescue mode

Restore an image on a given instance.
Shutdown a virtual server.

response.name: /vm/shutdown

formdata.description: The UUID of the SSH key

The SSH key value (the public value of the SSH key)

SSH keys UUID(s) to assign to virtual server

item.description:
The /vm section of the API allows its user to programmatically do what the client panel OneCloud manager does.

For exemple it can be used to automatically iterate througt all of a user vm and execute the reboot action on each of them.

item.name: /STORE

query.description: (optional - default 1) The search result page to display.
(optional - default 20, max 100) The number of results to display per page.
A comma-separated list of config IDs.
The maker of the CPU. [ AMD, Intel ]
The minimum amount of cores on the CPU.
The minimum frequency of the CPU in MHz.
The minimum benchmark of the CPU.
The minimum amount of RAM (in MB) found on the configurations.
The minimum amount of storage (in GB) that can be found in the configurations' drives.
The type of storage port that can be found on the configs. [ SATA | SAS ]
The type of drive that can be found on the configs. [ HDD | SSD | NVMe ]
The minimum amount of drive that can be found on the configs.
The minimum amount of IPs addresses that can be found on the configs.
The minimum bandwidth speed in Mbps that can be found on the configs.
The minimum amount of bandwidth in GB that can be found on the configs.
A comma-separated list of city IDs.
A comma-separated list of country IDs.
A comma-separated list of region IDs.
The minimum SLA Tier of the configs. [ 1 (Platinum), 2 (Gold), 3 (Silver), 4 (Bronze), 5 (Best Effort) ]
A comma-separated list of upgrade type IDs.
If the configs are sold-out.
If the configs have an active promotion.
The minimum price required of the configs.
The maximum price required of the configs.
The maximum price required of the configs.

query.description: (optional - default 1) The search result page to display.
(optional - default 20, max 100) The number of results to display per page.
(optional) The status of the carts to be returned [ Active | Ordered].

request.description: Get information on a specified cart.
Create a new shopping cart or return the current active one.
Empty and reset the settings of a shopping cart.

formdata.description: The amount of this configuration that should be in the cart.
(optional) A comma-separated list of Drive IDs.
(optional - required when not self-install) The Software ID to install on the new server.

(optional) List of upgrades, where the key is the upgrade type ID, and the value is the ID of the selected upgrade choice.
Exemple: {"10": 1175, "15": 6122}.

request.description: Add or update an item in the cart.

formdata.description: The amount of this configuration that should be in the cart.
(optional) A comma-separated list of Drive IDs.
(optional - required when not self-install) The Software ID to install on the new server.

(optional) List of upgrades, where the key is the upgrade type ID, and the value is the ID of the selected upgrade choice.
Exemple: {"10": 1175, "15": 6122}.

request.description: Remove an item from the cart.

formdata.description: The billing cycle of all products found in the cart. [ 1 (Monthly), 3 (Quarterly), 6 (Semi-Annually), 12 (Annually) ]
(optional) The promotion to attach to the cart.

request.description: Update the specified cart.

formdata.description: The billing cycle of all products found in the cart. [ 1 (Monthly), 3 (Quarterly), 6 (Semi-Annually), 12 (Annually) ]
(optional) The promotion to attach to the cart.

query.description: (optional - default 1) The search result page to display.
(optional - default 20, max 100) The number of results to display per page.
(optional) The status of the orders to be returned [Paid | Unpaid | Cancelled | Refunded].
(optional - default 1) If the order was made from the API.

response.name: /store/orders

query.description: (optional - default 1) The search result page to display.
(optional - default 20, max 100) The number of results to display per page.

(optional - default 1) If the order was made from the API.

request.description: Get information on a specified order.

response.name: /store/orders/{{order_id}}

item.description:
The /store section of the API allows its user to programmatically do what the shopping website does.

For exemple it can be used to search for a desired configuration and follow the whole checkout process to buy that configuration.

item.name: /INVOICES

query.description: (optional - default 1) The search result page to display.
(optional - default 20, max 100) The number of results to display per page.
(optional) The status of the invoices to be returned [Paid | Unpaid | Cancelled].
(optional) The ID of the server

    }
}

item.description:
The /invoices section of the API allows its user to programmatically do what the client panel does.

For exemple it can be used to search for unpaid invoices and pay them all one after the other.

item.name: /ACCOUNT

request.description: Get your account information.

item.description: The /account section allow user to fetch their account information.

request.description: Get a list of all your open/unread support tickets.

item.description:
The /support section of the API allows its user to programmatically do what the client panel does.

For exemple it can be used to open a new ticket or/and reply to one already existing.

item.name: /TAG

request.description: Get a list of tags.
Get a tag detailed information.

formdata.description: The project UUID of the tag, leave empty to have it available account wide.

formdata.description: The project UUID of the tag, leave empty to have it available account wide.

request.description: Edit a tag information.
Assign a tag to a service.
Unassign a tag from a service.
Delete a tag and all its assignations.

item.description:
The /tag section of the API allows its user to programmatically do what the client panel does.

For exemple it can be used to create and assign tag to server/vm part of the same project.
